subject: Entrepreneurship
title: IPO: The Biggest Fundraise of All
description: A quick, practical guide to IPO: The Biggest Fundraise of All.

hook.text: When Facebook IPO'd in 2012, it raised $16 billion in a single day. The biggest tech IPO in history.

buildup.text: An IPO (initial public offering) sells company shares to the public on a stock exchange.

discovery.text: Going public provides massive capital, liquidity for early investors, and brand credibility.

twist.text: Public companies face quarterly earnings pressure, SEC regulations, and activist shareholders.

climax.text: Many founders regret going public. The scrutiny and short-term pressure can kill innovation.

punchline.text: An IPO is a beginning, not an ending.

quiz.question: What is a major trade-off of going public through an IPO?
options: Massive capital and liquidity but increased regulatory burden and short-term pressure
Complete loss of founder control over the company
The company must be profitable before listing
